solution_line_template: The contribution of the students amounted to ${student_contribution_per_student} x {num_students} = $<<{student_contribution_per_student}*{num_students}={total_student_contribution}>>{total_student_contribution}.
So Miss Grayson's class had ${total_student_contribution} + ${initial_class_fund} = $<<{total_student_contribution}+{initial_class_fund}={total_funds_available}>>{total_funds_available} in all.
The cost of the field trip amounted to ${cost_per_student} x {num_students} = $<<{cost_per_student}*{num_students}={total_trip_cost}>>{total_trip_cost}.
Therefore, the class of Miss Grayson is left with ${total_funds_available} - ${total_trip_cost} = $<<{total_funds_available}-{total_trip_cost}={remaining_fund}>>{remaining_fund}.
